Authors:
Luis Quijada, Hans-Otto Baral, Ruth Jaen-Molina, Michael
Weiss, Juli Caujape-Castells, Esperanza Beltran-Tejera
Title:
Phylogenetic and morphological circumscription of the Orbilia
aurantiorubra group
Abstract:
Bayesian, maximum likelihood and maximum parsimony
phylogenetic inferences on the ITS sequences for a comprehensive
sampling of Orbilia aurantiorubra and related species support the
conclusions from morphological studies according to vital taxonomy.
Thus, the variability of the molecular and morphological data assessed
relative to ecological features such as substrate and geographical
origin suggest the existence of three new species related to Orbilia
aurantiorubra, which are described in this paper: Orbilia
xanthoguttulata from Europe, O. succulenticola from the Canary Islands
(Macaronesia bioregion), and O. jugulospora from Ethiopia (Africa) and
Taiwan (Southeast Asia).
